Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with enough water and light, showing it growing well.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing it wilting or not growing.
The student can draw a plant without light, showing it wilting or not growing.
The student can use their illustration to show that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can put labels or symbols on their drawing to highlight the presence or absence of water and light.
The student can use patterns in their drawings to communicate their observations about how plants respond to changes in water and light availability.
